meanings.definition: Make (someone) familiar with or aware of something.
meanings.sent1: I will familiarise my friend with the new game rules.
meanings.sent2: She decided to familiarise herself with the city map before the trip.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to familiarise itself with the new toy by sniffing it.
meanings.sent4: He wanted to familiarise his mind with the concept of time as a river.
meanings.sent5: The teacher used a fun game to familiarise the students with the periodic table.

meanings.sent1: Before the hike, I need to familiarise myself with the trail map.
meanings.sent2: She wanted to familiarise herself with the local customs before traveling.
meanings.sent3: The robot tried to familiarise itself with human emotions but found it challenging.
meanings.sent4: He tried to familiarise himself with the rhythm of the city, like a heartbeat.
meanings.sent5: The detective needed to familiarise himself with the suspect's background to solve the case.
